text:
The daily delivery drugs gang who used block text messages to tell addicts they were open for business Four men from Manchester have been jailed for 20 nearly years Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Four Manchester drug dealers flooded streets with heroin and cocaine - by sending out block text messages to let addicts know they were open for business. 
Nasar Ali, Shuqat Ali, Mohammed Rahman and Lukman Majeed travelled from Manchester to Blackburn on almost a daily basis last spring to sell class A drugs. 
But they were caught out in a sting by Lancashire Police, with an undercover officer posing as a drug user and recording secret footage. Shuqat Ali, who has been jailed for two years and four months for his role in a drugs gang 
The gang have now been sentenced at Preston Crown Court after pleading guilty to conspiracy to supply class A drugs. Read More The horrific face of Spice in Manchester: A young man fights for his life in hospital under police guard... 
Prosecuting, Jeremy Grout-Smith said the gang sold an estimated 840g of heroin and cocaine with a street value of £40,000. Nasar Ali, who has been jailed for six years and eight months for his role in a drugs gang 
But the court heard this value was a ‘conservative estimate’ and in all likelihood the value was far greater. 
The gang travelled from their homes in Cheetham Hill, Crumpsall and Levenshulme to Blackburn, then sent out block text messages advertising the drugs and letting users know they were in town and open for business. Lukman Majeed, who has been jailed for for his role in a drugs gang 
Customers would place orders and meet the gang in their car at meeting points across Blackburn town centre. 
Officers went undercover as drug addicts on a number of occasions to meet with the gang, to buy drugs and collect evidence. 
Judge Robert Altham praised the officers for their work. Mohammed Rahman, who has been jailed for four years and eight months for his part in a drugs gang 
He said: “One needs to commend the considerable bravery of those who carry out work such as this. 
“This was pro-active selling, pushing of class A drugs, not simply waiting for the users to come to them but making sure the users knew they were in the area and had these dangerous drugs to sell.” 
The court heard that Nasar Ali, from Cheetham Hill, boasted he was the head of the operation with the other men working on his orders. 
Shuqar Ali said he was only involved as the driver and would ferry the men between Manchester and Blackburn. Read More What is that annoying purple bird on Facebook? (And when will it go away!) 
But Judge Altham said: “Drug dealers, in order to ply their trade, need a vehicle and often they need a driver. 
“Mr Ali, regrettably, decided to involve himself in that role. He drove drug dealers around, knowing what they were doing.” 
Nasar Ali, 29, of Cheetham Hill Road, Cheetham Hill, who has two previous drug trafficking convictions as well as convictions for violence, was jailed for six years and eight months, with a separate four month concurrent sentence for possession of class A drugs on a separate occasion. 
Mohammed Rahman, 31, of Caremine Avenue, Levenshulme, was jailed for four years and eight months. 
Lukman Majeed, 31, of Broomfield Drive, Cheetham Hill, was jailed for five years and eight months. 
Shuqat Ali, 39, of Rectory Road, Crumpsall, was jailed for two years and four months. Like us on Facebook
